intro: Cymopterus douglassii, commonly known as the Douglas's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, while its stems are often sprawling or ascending. The seeds are enclosed in a capsule that splits open to release the seeds when mature.
